summary: Email chain between attorneys regarding an upcoming hearing in United States v. Maxwell, discussing arrangements for the defendant's attendance and communication with her. The document shows coordination between defense and prosecution regarding procedural matters.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: Attorney representing the defendant (Ghislaine Maxwell) in United States v. Maxwell, communicating with prosecutors about hearing arrangements and client communication.

persons.name: Brittany Henderson
persons.context: Copied on email correspondence regarding the Maxwell hearing, appears to be part of the legal team.

persons.name: Lara
persons.context: Sent an email checking in post-hearing and requesting times to speak with someone by phone.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in United States v. Maxwell, referenced as 'she' in emails discussing her attendance at a hearing regarding juror post-verdict statements.

connections.description: Edwards is representing Maxwell in her criminal case, communicating about her hearing attendance and emotional state.
Both are copied on legal correspondence regarding the Maxwell case, suggesting they work together on the defense.
Lara reached out to Edwards post-hearing to schedule a phone call, indicating professional coordination.

events.title: Hearing on Juror Post-Verdict Statements
events.description: Court hearing scheduled regarding defendant's motion about a juror's post-verdict statements in United States v. Maxwell.

locations.name: United States Attorney's Office Southern District of New York
locations.address: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007

keyFacts: A hearing was scheduled for March 8, 2022 regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's motion about a juror's post-verdict statements.
The defendant (Maxwell) was described as 'anxious' and would not be attending the hearing in person.
There was no telephone dial-in access for criminal proceedings in court, requiring special arrangements for remote attendance.
The email chain shows coordination between defense attorney Brad Edwards and prosecutors regarding procedural matters in the Maxwell case.
